word_mean: 不调和的：具不调和性的

sentence.Network_en: Something gave a loud discordant twang.
sentence.Network_cn: 什么东西突然发出了响亮刺耳的“嘣”的一声。

sentence.Network_en: His agenda is discordant with ours.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的日程安排和我们的有冲突。

sentence.Network_cn: 杂乱地震反射结构 ― ―是不连续 、 紊乱的地震反射图形.

jx.jx_en_mean: appear strange and out of place

lj.lj_ly: the chair's modernity struck a discordant note in a room full of eighteenth-century furniture.
lj.lj_ls: 在满屋子的18世纪家具中，这把充满现代感的椅子很是刺目。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French descordant, present participle of descorder (see discord)

entry.def: Something that is discordant is strange or unpleasant because it does not fit in with other things.

example.ex: His agenda is discordant with ours.
example.tran: 他的日程安排和我们的有冲突。

entry.tran: (声音)不和谐的，刺耳的，听起来突兀的
entry.def: A discordant sound or musical effect is unpleasant to hear.

auth_sentence.content: Testimony...in no case discordant with that of the Iliad.
auth_sentence.res_content: Testimony...in no case discordant with that of the Iliad.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Testimony...in no case discordant with that of the Iliad.

auth_sentence.content: Mixing with the superlatives are a few discordant notes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mixing with the superlatives are a few discordant notes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mixing with the superlatives are a few discordant notes.

auth_sentence.content: We could hear...a railway train...and its discordant screech.
auth_sentence.res_content: We could hear...a railway train...and its discordant screech.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We could hear...a railway train...and its discordant screech.
